clothing.name: chain store t-shirt
clothing.recommendation: Consider wearing high-quality clothing or buying from second hand.

food.name: pork
food.recommendation: Consider replacing it witch poultry. Poultry is the moust environmental friendly meat.

food.name: beef
food.recommendation: Consider replacing it with poultry. Poultry is the moust environmental friendly meat.

food.name: bottle of water
food.recommendation: Consider using a reusable bottle. Plastic bottles are realy envarimental unfriendly.

food.name: soybeans
food.recommendation: Consider eatin pulses instead. Soybeams require a lot of water to grow.

food.name: fish
food.recommendation: Consider eating pulses instead. Popular fish are geting overfished.

food.name: rice
food.recommendation: Consider replaceing it with potatoes. Rice require a lot of water to grow.

food.name: banana
food.recommendation: Consider replaycing it with apples. Bananas require a lot of water to grow.

food.name: peache
food.recommendation: Consider replaicing it with pears. Peaches require a lot of water to grow.

hygiene.name: plastic razor
hygiene.recommendation: Consider using reusable razor. Non-plastic Safety Razors can last a long time and are better for the environment.

hygiene.name: plastic toothbrush
hygiene.recommendation: Consider using wooden toothbrush. Stay clear of products like plastic toothbrushes that will never really decompose in landfills. You can switch to biodegradable bamboo toothbrushes instead.

hygiene.name: regular soap
hygiene.recommendation: Consider using organic soap. Many commercial soaps will contain toxic chemicals that wash down the drain and pollute the waterways and negatively affect marine life.

hygiene.name: regular shampoo in single-use bottle
hygiene.recommendation: Consider using organic soap or shampoo in reusable bottle. You can buy reusable tin containers to store the shampoo.

hygiene.name: organic shampoo in single-use bottle
hygiene.recommendation: Consider using soap in reusable bottle.
